content.description: This route is located 30 feet to the right of Cervesas in Zapata Land. Start in a shallow flare. A boulder problem start (crux) leads to a stance. Thin face moves lead to another stance with a left facing flake (pro) step right and mantle to the anchor. Easy to toprope after leading Five Finger Discount.
content.location: 30 feet uphill from Cervesas in Zapata Land

content.description: This is an enjoyable route that becomes more interesting the higher you get.  The crux move is about 20' below the anchor.
content.location: This is the favorite among most on this crag. This route is the center route of the three on the south face. The first bolt can easily be found to the right of "A Break in Security". Rap off Mussy hooks.

climbs.name: Horse Thief
climbs.fa: Nick Angelillo and Ryan Dozier, January 2021

content.description: An enjoyable romp up the left arete of Bandit Buttress. Well protected and a great way to steal that last bit of sun on a winter afternoon. Not the worst rock in Woodfords but not the best; expect a little exfoliation. This route will clean up nicely with traffic.
content.protection: 12 bolts, mussies at the top. 70m rope necessary! Step away (downhill) from the cliff with your rope when you pull it to avoid getting it stuck.
content.location: Now the left-most route at Bandit. Start at a very large white chockstone in an alcove.

content.description: A top rope route that can be easily climbed from the anchors of Cat Burglar/The Prowler. It connects an initial crack system with a thin left facing seam to the top portion of Cat Burglar.
content.protection: Top Rope from Cat Burglar anchors.
content.location: Start to the left of Cat Burglar on a medium/thin crack line.

content.description: Start 10 feet to the right of Smooth Criminal. Climb a shallow corner placing a few small pieces along the way. When the crack pinches down step left to a stance. Make a thin face move working your way right then back left to another stance. Make another thin move to a cool knob and the shared anchor of Smooth Criminal.
Thin moves have you wander up moving left than right to a tricky move to obtain a horizontal dike of sorts. Continue to the right then up.
content.protection: 5 bolts reasonably protect the bulk of this climb. Rap route from a chain anchor.  A TR can be set up via a hike up the gulley on the right.
content.location: This route can be found further up the right side of the buttress about 50' right of "Cat Burglar"

content.description: The tricky face move start getting to the third bolt is the crux. Good rock leads you up and right next to a large crack that pinches out to a ledge above. Step left and wonder up and over several blocks working up and left to the anchor. Shared anchor with "The Prowler".
content.location: This route is just up and right about 30' to the right of "The Prowler". Clip and lower or rap.

content.description: This is an enjoyable climb involving mostly crack on decent rock. Although this is usually climbed as a sport climb the FA was trad and can still be climbed as such. Bolts were placed to vastly improve rope management and to allow face climbing options right of the crack. A new anchor was installed on 7/3/20 with mussy hooks about 95' up. This a great climb for learning to place trad with bolts for back-up if needed.
content.protection: Bring a dozen quick draws and/ or gear to 3".
content.location: This is the route on the left of the south face. Rap off chains on the top summit block using a shorter rope down the backside or down the face off the mussy hooks with a 70m- Be sure to tie knots in the ends of the rope.
